intro: Fibraurea haematocarpus, commonly known as the blood fruit or red-veined plant, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its distinctive red-veined leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its unique botanical features include a fibrous root system and the ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. The fruit is a legume, containing several seeds that are dispersed by wind or animals.
